Fine weapons are instruments of ill omen. All things detest them. Therefore the man of the way does not dwell in them. The gentleman values the left in daily life, but values the right in war. Weapons are instruments of ill omen, not instruments of the gentleman. Whenä¸å¾—å·² use them, it is best to be calm and restrained. Victory should not be celebrated. Those who celebrate victory are those who enjoy killing. If you enjoy killing, you cannot gain the world. On auspicious occasions the left is valued, on inauspicious occasions the right is valued. The lieutenant general is on the left, the general on the right. This shows that they are placed as if for a funeral. When many people are killed, mourn them with grief. When victorious in war, observe it as a funeral.
